Title:
Niveofulviporus xanthochrous gen. et. sp. nov., a
xanthochroic polypore in Polyporales from China
Abstract:
A new genus, Niveofulviporus, is proposed based on
morphological characters and molecular data. It is typified by N.
xanthochrous sp. nov., characterized by its resupinate basidiocarps with
darkening reaction in KOH, a monomtic hyphal system with simple septa
and hyaline to yellowish generative hyphae, and hyaline, and
thin-walled, cylindric to oblong-ellipsoid basidiospores. Phylogenetic
analysis of N. xanthochrous and its related species was inferred from
ITS and nLSU rDNA sequences, which indicates that it belongs to
Phanerochaetaceae.
